meanings.definition: To push or persuade someone too much or too strongly.
meanings.sent1: She kept overurging her friend to try the new roller coaster, even though he was scared.
meanings.sent2: The coach warned the players not to overurge their teammates during the game.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully accused the students of overurging her to give less homework.
meanings.sent4: His constant overurging felt like a relentless push towards a goal that wasn't his own.
meanings.sent5: The image of overurging stuck in her mind like a stubborn stain.

meanings.sent1: The parents were overurging their child to eat all his vegetables, even though he was full.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to overurge her friend to join the dance class if he wasn't interested.
meanings.sent3: The dog's tail wagged happily as if overurging its owner to play fetch.
meanings.sent4: The overurging voices in his head pushed him to take risks he wasn't comfortable with.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of overurging lingered in the room, making everyone uneasy.
